intro: Monnina marginata, commonly known as bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces delicate, violet-blue flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features include small, lance-shaped leaves and a basal rosette growth habit. Monnina marginata is part of the family Onagraceae, which includes other showy flowering plants.
